alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bay; South Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued March 30 at 4:42AM EDT until March 31 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Walton and Bay County Beaches. * WHEN...From 1 PM CDT this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The day will start with moderate rip current risk. The return of southeast and southerly seabreezes along Emerald Coast beaches this afternoon will start to increase rip current risk. The setup for high risk is marginal, and confidence is low on whether the rip risk will eventually qualify as high this afternoon.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
